cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting northwest toward the South Carolina coast, then forecast to turn northward along the U.S. East Coast and accelerate northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast near Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from Georgia through North Carolina with potential impacts extending northward to the Mid-Atlantic and New England, including New Jersey and Long Island
weather_observation.wind: Only a 5% cumulative chance of experiencing sustained 34-kt winds; strong winds are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; storm will be offshore when closest to the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible, generally less than 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along New Jersey and Long Island beaches.
